document.docAuthor: Niu, Ze-Qing, Ascher, John S., Griswold, Terry & Zhu, Chao-Dong
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the bee genus Bathanthidium Mavromoustakis (Hymenoptera: Apoidea Megachilidae: Anthidiini) with description of a new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the bee genus Bathanthidium Mavromoustakis (Hymenoptera: Apoidea Megachilidae: Anthidiini) with description of a new species from China

heading.emphasis:
Key to the known species of
Bathanthidium

subSubSection.paragraph:
(Females of
B. bicolor
,
B. monganshanense ,
males of
B. fengkaiense
,
B. hainanense
,
B. emeiense
unknown, not be included in the key)

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Fovea behind propodeal spiracle rounded, delimited by strong carina....................... 3 B . (
Bathanthidium
s. str. )
- Fovea behind propodeal spiracle elongate, weakly delimited................................................... 5

3 Paraocular area with thin and long yellow marking extending along the inner margin to the top of the eye......................................................................... B. (
Bathanthidium
s. str. )
bifoveolatum ( Alfken, 1937 )
- Paraocular area near ventral extreme with a small sub-triangle or sub-rectangle dull yellow marking................... 4

4 T1–T2 black, without yellow marking, T3–T5 with broader yellow bands, the band on T3 obviously interrupted medially; paraocular area yellow marking sub-rectangle; the lowest tooth on mandible acute......................................................................................... B . (
Bathanthidium
s. str )
fengkaiense Niu & Zhu
,
sp. nov.

- T1 black, T2 medially with a pair of small, stripe-like yellow markings, T3–T5 with broader yellow bands, the bands on T3–T5 entire, not interrupted medially; the lowest tooth on mandible slightly rounded........................................................................................... B. (
Bathanthidium
s. str )
hainanense Niu, Wu & Zhu, 2012
- Basal zone of propodeum distinct laterally, with regular, shiny, nearly horizontal pits...............8 B . ( Stenanthidiellum )
6 T6 yellow or with yellow fasciae basally; paraocular area black or with thin and long yellow marking.................. 7

- T6 black; paraocular area near ventral extreme with dull yellow marking or black....................................................................................................
B . ( Manthidium ) atriceps ( Morawitz, 1890 )

7 T6 with yellow fasciae basally; paraocular area with thin and long yellow marking extending along the inner margin nearly to the top of the eye.....................................................
B. ( Manthidium ) barkamense ( Wu, 1986 )

- T6 yellow; paraocular area black, without yellow marking.....................
B . ( Manthidium ) binghami ( Friese, 1901 )

8 Scutellum with two broad yellow markings apically..........................
B. ( Stenanthidiellum ) emeiense Wu, 2004

9 Metasomal terga dull, not shiny; mandible with four teeth..................
B . ( Stenanthidiellum ) malaisei ( Popov, 1941 )
- Metasomal terga shiny; mandible with two or three teeth..................................................... 10

10 Mandible with two teeth; paraocular area near ventral extreme with small yellow marking.......................................................................................
B . ( Stenanthidiellum ) sibiricum ( Eversmann, 1852 )

- Mandible with three teeth, 3 rd tooth more than 2x as far from dorsal tooth as from 2 nd tooth; paraocular area black, without yellow marking...................................................
B. ( Stenanthidiellum ) rubopunctatum ( Wu, 1993 )

11 Fovea behind propodeal spiracle rounded, delimited by strong carina; T7 trilobed, median lobe longest and broad, lateral lobe short and acute; paraocular area with thin and long yellow marking extending along the inner margin to the top of the eye............................................................ B. (
Bathanthidium
s. str. )
bifoveolatum ( Alfken, 1937 )

- Fovea behind propodeal spiracle elongate, weakly delimited; T7 simple or with slightly produced median lobe (T7 of
B . malaisei
otherwise); paraocular area black or with different shape yellow marking.................................... 12
- Basal zone of propodeum distinct laterally, with regular, shiny, nearly horizontal pits..............17 B . ( Stenanthidiellum )
13 Paraocular area yellow marking thin and long, extending along the inner margin to the top or middle of the eye.......... 14
- Paraocular area yellow marking broad and short, only extending to the low margin of antennal socket................. 15

14 Mandible with two teeth; paraocular area yellow marking extending nearly to the top of the eye...........................................................................................
B. ( Manthidium ) barkamense ( Wu, 1986 )

- Mandible with three teeth; paraocular area yellow marking extending to the middle of the eye................................................................................................
B. ( Manthidium ) bicolor ( Wu, 2004 )

15 T6 with yellow marking medially........................................
B. ( Manthidium ) binghami ( Friese, 1901 )

16 Clypeus and with shallow and sparse punctures; apicomedian margin of clypeus nearly straight.........................................................................................
B. ( Manthidium ) atriceps ( Morawitz, 1890 )

- Clypeus with deep and dense punctures; apicomedian margin of clypeus strongly extend..............................................................................................
B. ( Manthidium ) moganshanense ( Wu, 2004 )

17 Paraocular area yellow marking thin and long, extending along the inner margin to the top or middle of the eye; T7 trilobed, the median lobe long and broad, lateral lobe small and acute...................
B. ( Stenanthidiellum ) malaisei ( Popov, 1941 )

- Paraocular area yellow marking broad and short, only extending to the low margin of antennal socket; T7 medially slightly produced or truncated................................................................................. 18

18 T7 medial projection triangular point with lateral shoulders..............
B . ( Stenanthidiellum ) rubopunctatum ( Wu, 1993 )

- T7 simple, truncated apically....................................
B . ( Stenanthidiellum ) sibiricum ( Eversmann, 1852 )
